resources.string: This data stays at your phone. They are not mandatory, so leave empty inputs to continue. Mail service is discontinued, but SMS sending is still available.
Something went wrong - check your internet connection

This is BeSafeBox, the fall detection app. In case of fall of a person, this app have an algorithm to detect it and call for help, if you are not able to. In case of an emergency, the app is able to send a SMS and a mail to the specific contact of your choice.

This app is currently not under development or researched further, because of instability of the Android environment for apps working in the background, where the risk of killing the app is high by manufacturer battery saving routines.

"Total accuracy for the models is on average 80 – 91 %, when precision for the fall is 70 – 80 %. Tha app was tested on 3260 simulated scenarios with real falls and events similar to fall. The best model is used by default."

"With moving to the main screen, you accept that the BeSafeBox comes with no warranties and guarantees for your safety. Use it at your own risk and responsibility. The creators do not take any responsibility for a malfunction or an unreliability of the app."

To access GPS, while you are not able to interact with phone, the app needs to find location for your contact in the background. This is the reason, why we need to access the location from background.\n\n None of the required permissions are obligatory.

To access GPS, we need you to give us permission to use it. The GPS is only used, when the alarm is triggered to format SMS and mail for your contact to find you. In the next slide we will ask you for background permission. \n\n None of the required permissions are obligatory.

To access GPS, we need you to give us permission to use it. The GPS is only used, when the alarm is triggered to format SMS and mail for your contact to find you.\n\n None of the required permissions are obligatory.
To send SMS to your contact, the app needs access to SMS manager, so it can send message to your contact.\n\n None of the required permissions are obligatory.

App was not successful in search for battery optimizations. We recommend to search battery optimizer and put app into the white list. Not doing this can result in poor performance of detection and shutdowns.
Contact info required for the sensor - go to settings
SMS and GPS permission with background access is required to alarm
SMS and GPS permission is required to use it with your contact
App needs activity recognition permission to lower consumption
To use real alarm - set up name and phone number
Provides important notification for BeSafeBox app about state of the detection
App will not be able to provide location in dangerous situation. Try to go for more open area.
Error occurred, try to change number/mail/name
GPS is turned off. Do you want to turn it on? It is essential part of app.
Cost of SMS is not covered by app or its creators.
I want to use full alarm, but I don\'t want to alarm somebody.
I want to use full alarm to contact my \'assistant\' - Full alarm will be used.
On low battery, the detection will be turned off
The detector will be active only inside a pocket
Detector will go to sleep, when there is no activity
Fill the name and phone number to enable alarm

This data stay only in your phone and are not gathered by any third party. If you want to use the alarm, you need to add your name and one of the two available ways of contacting your emergency contact - mail or phone number.

Otherwise, the alarm will not send any emergency message.
Mail sending is discontinued due to the absent service provider.

"The BeSafeBox is experimental app, which can detect collapse of a person. The alarm is launched as a reaction to the detection and the phone will try to attract attention of someone. In manner of seconds, the app sends coordinates to emergency contact about unfortunate event, so they can check on them or send someone to make sure, nothing bad has happened."
